page.title: 05Ecology, Faceby
page.content: { The climate}is affected by strong winds from the North Sea. Drier than the national average, it has a shorter growing season. Lack of use of {herbicides}on grazed areas makes the moorland fringe relatively good. The old churchyard is an undisturbed area, important against a background of intensive farming, with Green Hairstreak, Painted Lady, Wall Brown and Little Copper{butterflies.} {Bird life}includes Lapwing, Curlew, Crossbill, Grouse, Pheasant, Wheatear, and the occasional Peregrine, Merlin, Snowbunting and Honey Buzzard. Goulton Stell, Carlton Bank and Faceby ponds support a diversity of{aquatic animals {and waterfowl,}together with dragonflies (2 spp.) and damselflies (1 sp.), water beetles, leeches, frogs and toads.{Adders and lizards}thrive on the moors.
